Published: Monday, January 16, 2012, 2:20 PM Updated: Monday, January 16, 2012, 2:27 PM By Brad Flory | bflory2@mlive.com The Jackson Citizen Patriot Follow 7 Share close Digg Stumble Upon Fark Reddit Share Email Print Saturday's column about refusing to "go paperless" by receiving bills over the Internet instead of in the mail brought a helpful suggestion from several readers. "Sign up to have your bills paid automatically," these people said. "The money comes out of your bank account and you don't have to do a thing." This may work fine for many people, but not me. It's not that I distrust Discover Card and the phone company and Consumers Energy. The problem is, I do not trust myself. Mostly, I don't trust myself to have enough cash in my checking account when creditors automatically help themselves. Secondarily, when I do have money in the bank, I do not trust myself to notice how much they remove until I overdraw the account. For me, automatic bill-paying would not be easy. It would be a prescription for bounce fees. I imagine I am not alone.
